author: Staff Reporter
text:
A total of 855 Indian Army soldier aspirants took the written exam that was conducted at Nehru Stadium here on Sunday. They were among the candidates who had cleared the physical fitness test at the recruitment rally held at Krishnagiri in October 2015.

Director (Recruiting) of the Area Recruiting Office of Indian Army, Coimbatore, Colonel H. Praveen said that around 12,000 youth from Madurai, Theni, Dindigul, Coimbatore, The Nilgiris, Erode, Tirupur, Salem, Namakkal, Dharmapuri and from Krishnagiri participated in the rally.

Qualified

Around 1,250 of them qualified for the written test.

On Sunday, these aspirants wrote for the posts of Soldier general duty, technical and tradesman. Examination result will be published online atwww.tn.gov.inin a week.

The date for the written exam for Solider clerk will soon be announced.

Those who cleared the exams will be asked to come to the recruiting office at Red Field for certificate verification and other formalities before they are sent for training.

They had cleared the physical fitness test at the recruitment rally held at Krishnagiri
title: Soldier aspirants take up written exam
